issue.title: Optimization: batch update cancelledOrFilled amount
Optimization by simplifying NameRegistry and removing miner signatures
issue.body: We can relax the requirement that a miner needs to sign the ring as the ring will be signed with all the auth_key of the orders,  then we can simplify NameRegistry to keep only the recipient address in the mapping.

issue.title: ERC20Token constructor should check input parameters
issue.body:
It should check:
1) token symbol contains only uppercase A to Z and ".".  "." can occur at most once in the middle. The token symbol shall be less than 10 chars.
2) token name contains only "A-Za-z_-" and " ". Lengh <= 128 chars.
3) digits shall be >=3 and <= 8

issue.title: Optimization: remove salt from orders
issue.body: The salt was introduced to make sure if all other parameters are the same, orders can still have different hashes. Now that we have ‘timpestamp’ field, we can use it to make sure orders with the same parameters can have different hashes. If the unit of ‘timestamp’ is second, we can append change it to milliseconds so the ‘mill’ part can act as the salt.

issue.title: Split `amount filled` and `amount cancelled` for better UI display
add `cancelAllOrdersForTradingPair` functionality
issue.body:
Currently we have a ` setCutoff` method, this is essentially to cancel all orders whose timestamp is less than the current timestamp. We need to enable user to cancel all orders for specific trading pairs.

We will need to rename `setCutoff` to `cancelAllOrders`

issue.title: Wallet get a percentage of mining income.
issue.body:
The current design of Loopring has a nice incentive mechanism for ring-miners. But it doesn't really offer any reward for wallets and website that help user to manage their orders.

We can provide such an incentive mechanism, by allowing wallet to supply an address in the order to split the fee or margin-split with miners. The percentage of LRC or margin-split should be configurable upon deployment.

issue.title: Write batch register token script
issue.body:
This script should pass an input string in form of:

```
0x2956356cD2a2bf3202F771F50D3D14A367b48070  ERC20 18  WETH    Ether Token
0xEF68e7C694F40c8202821eDF525dE3782458639f  ERC20 18  LRC     Loopring
0x86fa049857e0209aa7d9e616f7eb3b3b78ecfdb0  ERC223 18  EOS     EOS
```

and generate geth console command lines. Please create a script directory.

issue.title: TokenRegistry should provide a getTokens(skip, size) method.
issue.body: Another improvement for TokenRegistry is to provide a new method `getTokens(skip, size)` to  enable querying a portion of `tokens` array. If There are 5 thousands tokens, returning the entire list will be very slow  even impossible.

issue.title: TokenRegistry's unregisterToken need refractory
issue.body:
This `unregisterToken` now takes O(n) time. We really need to change it to O(1) otherwise when the list is too long, we'll eventually run out of gas before a token near the end of the list can be unregistered.

We will probably support thousands of tokens in the future.

issue.title: comment on this 2.0 branch
issue.body: All 2.0 related issues will be tagged with 'version2'

issue.title: Allow minimalFillAmount and/or minimalFillPercentage parameter
issue.body: These two parameter will make sure the actual fillAmount must be greater than or equal to  minimalFillAmount or fillAmount/outstandingOrderAmount must e greater than or equal to minimalFillPercentage

issue.title: fee calculation adjustment
issue.body: If an address doesn't have any LRC but will receive LRC as a result of trading, paying LRC fee should also succeed in most cases.

issue.title: Change submitRinghash to accept a calculated bytes32 instead of order parameters
Allow user to authorize and de-authorize each version of the protocol
issue.body:
Currently the only authorization a user has to do is setting up allowance that TokenTransferDelegate can leverage. When we added new versions, all of them will inherit the capability of spending money that was previous authorized. If one version is hacked, the all people's money is at risk.

We should consider allowing each address to authorize and de-authorize new versions of the protocol.

issue.title: Emit OrderCancelled event when an order get cancelled.
Implement logc to prevent ring from being stolen
issue.body: We should allow ring-miners to submit a ring-fingerprint before submitting a ring. THe finger-print should be order-indenpendent, i.e, A ring `X->Y->Z` should have the same fingerprint as ring `Y->Z->X`.

issue.title: Missing test cases
issue.body: We need to test when any order's fillAmountS is 0, the ring will fail.

issue.title: add a parameter in submitRing function to control the minial amount the ring will be settled.
Various data optimizations
issue.body:
This saves about ~35.000 gas (464.000 -> 426.000)

Note: all tests are working except the raw transaction test. I'm not sure what kind of transaction that is or what the purpose is, so I have temporarily disabled it in this PR.

This PR tries to use the call data better:
- Tries to pack data together
- But more importantly it reads data from the call data more efficiently (the key to this is the `calldatacopy` and `calldataload` assembly functions) without having to go through slow solidity array lookups

This PR also adds some simple XOR compression to values in the call data.

Storing everything in a single bytes array for submitRing() should open some posibilities:
- More extensible
- Easier to pack data together to save gas
- Easy to send the data needed to settle multiple rings in a single transaction (if possible: #351)

issue.title: Various data optimizations
issue.body:
This saves about ~35.000 gas (464.000 -> 426.000)

Note: all tests are working except the raw transaction test. I'm not sure what kind of transaction that is or what the purpose is, so I have temporarily disabled it in this PR.

This PR tries to use the call data better:
- Tries to pack data together
- But more importantly it reads data from the call data more efficiently (the key to this is the `calldatacopy` and `calldataload` assembly functions) without having to go through slow solidity array lookups

This PR also adds some simple XOR compression to values in the call data.

Storing everything in a single bytes array for submitRing() should open some posibilities:
- More extensible
- Easier to pack data together to save gas
- Easy to send the data needed to settle multiple rings in a single transaction (if possible: #351)
